• Overview
  • Package
  • Type
Shadow Standard Library

shadow:standard

Singleton CurrentThread

Parent class

shadow:standard@Object

Interfaces

shadow:standard@CanIndex<int,shadow:standard@Thread>

singleton CurrentThread

Singleton CurrentThread provides methods which can be called on the current thread. It also provides a way to access the actual Thread instance of this thread.

Author

Claude Abounegm

See Also

shadow:standard@Thread

Create Detail

create

public create() => ()

destroy

public destroy() => ()

Method Detail

childAt

public readonly locked childAt(int index) => (Thread)

Gets the n-th child that this thread spawned. This is NOT the Shadow-specific Thread->id. If the thread has four children, this method could be used to retrieve the n-th child, for example the third child (thus, its index is 2).

Parameters

index - the index of the child in the range [0, childrenCount).

children

public readonly locked children() => (CanIterate<Thread>)

Gets the children of this thread. This method only enumerates through the first generation children of this thread. i.e. only the thread that this thread spawned.

Returns

CanIterate<Thread> An iterable class to be used with a foreach loop.

children

public readonly locked children(boolean recurse) => (CanIterate<Thread>)

Gets the children of this thread, and if recurse is true, this method will also traverse the children of the children recursively, until all children have been visited. Care should be taken using this function, as enumerating can throw an exception if the children have changed.

Returns

CanIterate<Thread> An iterable class to be used with a foreach loop.

copy

public readonly copy(AddressMap addresses) => (CurrentThread)

equal

public readonly locked equal(nullable Thread other) => (boolean)

Checks whether the thread is the same as the current thread. This is equivalent to thread->isCurrentThread, but with null checking as well.

Parameters

other - The thread to equate against the current thread.

Returns

true if the other thread is not null and is the current thread; otherwise, false.

index

public readonly locked index(int index) => (Thread)

Gets the n-th child that this thread spawned. This is NOT the Shadow-specific Thread->id. If the thread has four children, this method could be used to retrieve the n-th child, for example the third child (thus, its index is 2).

Parameters

index - the index of the child in the range [0, childrenCount).

interrupt

public locked interrupt() => ()

Requests this thread to be interrupted. If the thread is currently in the WAITING state, the thread is interrupted and the method that caused the thread to be in the WAITING state raises an InterruptedException. The methods which are interruptible are join(), sleep(), send(), receive(), and all their overloads. If the thread is not in the WAITING state, an interrupt flag is set, and the thread is interrupted as soon as one of the above interruptible methods above are called, or when the user calls CurrentThread.throwIfInterrupting(), or throws an exception using CurrentThread->interrupting.

sleep

public readonly locked sleep(int millisecondsTimeout) => ()

Suspends the current running thread for milliseconds milliseconds.

Parameters

millisecondsTimeout - The milliseconds to pause this thread for.

sleep

public readonly locked sleep(TimeSpan timeout) => ()

Suspends the current running thread for the specfied amount of time.

Parameters

timeout - The amount of time to pause this thread for.

throwIfInterrupting

public locked throwIfInterrupting() => ()

Throws an InterruptedException if the current thread has been requested to interrupt. This can be used as a cancellation point in the program. The throwIfInterrupting() should be called at safe points where the thread is safe to get interrupted. This method should only be used if there is no code that should be executed before throwing the exception; otherwise, use CurrentThread->interrupting. This method, as the interrupting() one, resets the interrupt flag, and sets it to false. This code executed in this method is simply: if(CurrentThread->interrupting) throw InterruptedException:create();

toString

public readonly locked toString() => (String)

Returns a string with the format: "Thread ({Thread->name}): {Thread->stateStr}".

yield

public readonly locked yield() => (boolean)

Causes the current thread to yield execution to another thread.

Returns

true if the yield was successful; otherwise, false.

Property Detail

childrenCount

public readonly get locked childrenCount() => (int)

Gets the number of children the thread currently has. This method should be used with caution even though it is thread safe. Since a thread can spawn threads at any time, this count can drastically change between each call.

id

public readonly get locked id() => (int)

Gets the Shadow-specific thread ID.

instance

public readonly get locked instance() => (Thread)

Gets the current thread's actual instance.

Returns

The instance of the current thread.

interrupting

public get locked interrupting() => (boolean)

Gets whether the thread should be interrupted and resets the interrupt flag to false. The way it should be used it as follows: if(CurrentThread->interrupting) throw InterruptedException:create();

main

public readonly get locked main() => (Thread)

Gets the main thread, which is the root of all threads.

name

public readonly get locked name() => (String)

Gets the name of the thread set at spawn time. If no name is set at spawn time, the name takes the format "Thread#{id}".

parent

public readonly get locked parent() => (nullable Thread)

Gets the Thread which spawned this thread. The Main thread does not have a parent, and is null.
